Comment: not clear what, if any, analyses are included

Not clear what analyses results are available, none explicitly linked from the collection page. After communication with the helpdesk, turns out this collection is not curated completely yet, although it is marked as Completed on the TCIA front page.
Mapping from GTV contour name to the type of the contour is available in a mapping spreadsheet, so potentially can be further harmonized.
AIM objects contain semantic annotation of the findings, and also spatial localization of the finding using TwoDimensionCircle markup type.
Analysis results probably refer to the CCC 2017 annotations, available in a separate collection.
Radiology refers to CCC 2017 annotations. Pathology analysis results are TIL maps, stored in RGB PNG. All analyses live in analysis results collections
all analyses live in analysis results collections
Excel spreadsheet contains details about representative tumor slices (SOPInstanceUID, InstanceNuber, ImagePositionPatient).
All analyses live in analysis results collections.

By analysis results are probably meant the Matlab and NIfTI representations of the 4D DCE series. There is also AIF shared as Excel spreadsheet.
All analyses live in analysis results collections.
Location of the nodule center and number of slice (after sorting slices by InstanceNumber), and the diagnosis for the individual nodules.
Pathology and radiology report text.
Qualitative assessment of brain tumor images following VASARI template.

The location (bounding box) of each tumor was annotated by five academic thoracic radiologists with expertise in lung cancer to make this dataset a useful tool and resource for developing algorithms for medical diagnosis.  Two of the radiologists had more than 15 years of experience and the others had more than 5 years of experience. After one of the radiologists labeled each subject the other four radiologists performed a verification, resulting in all five radiologists reviewing each annotation file in the dataset.  Annotations were captured using Labellmg.  The image annotations are saved as XML files in PASCAL VOC format, which can be parsed using the PASCAL Development Toolkit:  https://pypi.org/project/pascal-voc-tools/.  Python code to visualize the annotation boxes on top of the DICOM images can be downloaded here.
Segmentations of the prostate and lesions saved in STL. Vectors defining locations of biopsy needles are saved in 3D Slicer MRML scene format.

There appear to be no analysis results. The collection contains pathology images for multiplex immunofluorescence assay (mIF) using multispectral microscopy and multiplex immunohistochemistry assay (mIHC).

Radiology analysis refers to some segmentations, but those appear not to be linked from the wiki page. Submitted issue https://help.cancerimagingarchive.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/TH-47044. Pathology annotations are saved in TIFF.

[Slide-level] annotations are given in the file annotations.dat. In this file, the first column gives the name of the respective image file and the second column the morphological class assigned during the gold-standard annotation. If a single-cell image was re-annotated, the result of the first re-annotation process by a second independent annotator is given in the third column, and the result of the second re-annotation process after a time interval of 11 months by the same re-annotator in the fourth column. If a single-cell image was not re-annotated, the third and fourth column contain the value "nan".
Transformation matrices, landmarks.
Excel contains acquisition parameters, since per authors, the ones in DICOM may be incorrect.
PDF link is broken, but presumably PDF contains "Annotated plasma cell images".

Various image-extracted features. The images are labelled as Non-Tumor, Viable Tumor and Necrosis according to the predominant cancer type in each image, but not obvious how this was recorded (perhaps need to download images first).
Presumably, analysis results here refer to the generation of perfusion image and co-registration of invididual series. No non-DICOM artifacts are referenced.
Characteristics and perhaps mask for the mass finding. Need to download and investigate more.

No non-image artifacts linked from the collection page. Presumably, this one is marked as analysis results because it was shared for a challenge, and there are analysis results collections accompanying it.
Fiducials annotated in IJK, Ktrans maps in MHD, reference thumbnails with lesion annotations.
Pseudo whole mounts obtained by stitching. Fused rad-path images in Matlab format.
A medical student manually performed slice-by-slice segmentations of the pancreas as ground-truth and these were verified/modified by an experienced radiologist.
Points/linear measurements of nodes done using MITK. Volumetric annotations in NIfTI.
Prostate and surrounding structures segmentations.
